subclusters.subcluster_name: Error-Prone Protein Synthesis and Aggregation Theory
Proteostasis Network Decline and Stress Response Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Error-Prone Protein Synthesis and Aggregation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on ribosomal translational errors causing misfolded proteins and aggregation driving aging and neurodegeneration.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Error-Prone Protein Synthesis and Aggregation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes how error-prone protein translation disrupts proteostasis and accelerates aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Error-Prone Protein Synthesis and Aggregation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Posits that random protein misfolding from translation errors causes neurodegenerative aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Error-Prone Protein Synthesis and Aggregation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes accumulation of damaged/aggregated proteins causing cytoplasmic crowding and aging in bacteria.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Error-Prone Protein Synthesis and Aggregation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on protein destabilization and self-assembly into aggregates as drivers of aging disorders.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Error-Prone Protein Synthesis and Aggregation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes protein misfolding leading to insolubility and membrane toxicity contributing to aging and disease.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Error-Prone Protein Synthesis and Aggregation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links proteostasis impairment to amyloid deposition and tissue degeneration in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Error-Prone Protein Synthesis and Aggregation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes metabolic regulation of proteostasis affecting protein aggregation and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline and Stress Response Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on proteostatic stress responses and their decline impacting aging and protein homeostasis.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline and Stress Response Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes age-dependent deterioration of HSF1-regulated proteostasis and links to neurodegeneration.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline and Stress Response Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Discusses age-related decline in proteostasis network and stress response pathways affecting aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline and Stress Response Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes proteostasis network collapse and chaperome imbalance as hallmarks of aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteasome Dysfunction and Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on age-related decline in proteasome function and altered proteasome complex dynamics.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteasome Dysfunction and Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes decline in proteasome activity and role of Hsc70 chaperone in aging proteostasis.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteasome Dysfunction and Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links oxidative stress to proteolytic system dysfunction and accumulation of damaged proteins.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteasome Dysfunction and Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on accumulation of oxidized proteins and decline in proteolytic degradation with age.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteasome Dysfunction and Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes balance between protein oxidation and degradation, with proteasomal decline in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteasome Dysfunction and Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details enzymatic repair and ubiquitin-proteasome targeting of spontaneously damaged proteins.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline and Stress Response Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Integrates proteostasis loss, oxidative damage, and translational dysregulation affecting aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Proteostasis Network Decline and Stress Response Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes Ranbp2-dependent proteostatic remodeling and chaperone regulation influencing aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Chemical Modification Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on spontaneous non-enzymatic protein modifications accumulating and impairing function.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Chemical Modification Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes oxidative protein damage accumulation, especially nuclear protein carbonyls, driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Chemical Modification Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links oxidative damage and protein prenylation regulation as anti-aging mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Chemical Modification Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes accumulation of chemically modified proteins and failure of quality control with age.
